Comments: \t\t\t\t
THE SHELL AND BOTTOM HEAD HAVE PITTING AND GENERAL CORROSION THAT IS BELOW THE T MIN FOR THE DESIGN PRESSURE OF THIS VESSEL AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO KEEP THE VESSEL IN SERVICE A NEW T MIN FOR THE SHELL AND HEADS CAN BE ASSUMED. THE DEEPEST PITS COULD BE REPAIRED AND THE SHELL T MIN SET AT 0.400É?ù AND THE BOTTOM HEAD T MIN SET AT 0.640É?ù WHICH WOULD GIVE A SLIGHT AMOUNT OF CORROSION ALLOWANCE. AT THESE NEW VALUES THE VESSEL COULD BE OPERATED AT 92 PSI MAWP. THIS WOULD BE AT THE OWNERS DISCRETION. IT APPEARS THAT THE PRV ON THIS VESSEL IS SET AT 50 PSI.
FOR FULL CODE COMPLIANCE THE VESSEL SHALL BE DE-RATED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CALIFORNIA OCCUPOATIONAL SAFETY - PRESSURE VESSEL UNIT CIRCULAR LETTER PV-2006-2 AND CIRCULAR LETTER PV-2001-1.\t\t\t\t
\t\t\t\t
OUT OF SERVICE, TYE HAMMOND, 10/05/2009\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
UltraPipe Unit ID PAN FEE
UltraPipe Circuit 7886
" "

THE SHELL AND BOTTOM HEAD HAVE PITTING AND GENERAL CORROSION THAT IS BELOW THE T MIN FOR THE DESIGN PRESSURE OF THIS VESSEL AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO KEEP THE VESSEL IN SERVICE A NEW T MIN FOR THE SHELL AND HEADS CAN BE ASSUMED. THE DEEPEST PITS COULD BE REPAIRED AND THE SHELL T MIN SET AT 0.400É?ù AND THE BOTTOM HEAD T MIN SET AT 0.640É?ù WHICH WOULD GIVE A SLIGHT AMOUNT OF CORROSION ALLOWANCE. AT THESE NEW VALUES THE VESSEL COULD BE OPERATED AT 92 PSI MAWP. THIS WOULD BE AT THE OWNERS DISCRETION. IT APPEARS THAT THE PRV ON THIS VESSEL IS SET AT 50 PSI.
FOR FULL CODE COMPLIANCE THE VESSEL SHALL BE DE-RATED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE CALIFORNIA OCCUPOATIONAL SAFETY - PRESSURE VESSEL UNIT CIRCULAR LETTER PV-2006-2 AND CIRCULAR LETTER PV-2001-1.

Inspector: Ronnie Harleston

Find in Virtual Tour
Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Thickness Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were completed in accordance with Applus RTD established procedures. 3 thickness measurement locations (TMLs) were established and thickness measurements were taken at these locations. All thickness readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data next inspection will be 07/30/2019. The predicted retirement date of the circuit is 07/30/2033 based on calculated corrosion rates and a 2 mil per year default corrosion rate. There are 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness survey taken on 07/30/2014.
API 570 Visual Inspection:
Visual inspection found this piping circuit to be in fair condition. This piping circuit externally is insulated. The insulation is found to be in poor condition, with missing or damage insulation, and in the areas the insulation is missing the surface condition of the piping is covered with light to moderate surface rust. The piping supports surface was covered with light to moderate surface rust and no corrosion was present. Support hangers were found to be in fair condition. The piping was inspected for code compliance issues and to identify possible leaks, stresses and any condition that might reduce the life of the piping circuit. All piping will be put on a maximum 5 year thickness inspection interval per API (class 2 piping) requirements. Some piping TML locations may require re-inspection prior to the maximum interval. See UltraPIPE data reports for all required inspection dates.
Recommendations: Repair insulation as needed.
All piping will require an API 570 Visual inspection in 5 years.
UltraPipe Unit ID ETHEL_D
UltraPipe Circut ID WELL 79
" "

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the heads, shell, and nozzles. All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data the next inspection will be 06/07/2017. The predicted retirement date of the vessel is 09/05/2019 based on calculated corrosion rates and a 2 mil per year default corrosion rate. There are 6 caution TMLs per the current thickness survey taken on 03/11/2015. Caution TMLs are due to high corrosion rates.
API 510 External Inspection:
External visual inspection was performed and found this vessel to be in fair condition. The coating on this vessels exterior shell and heads is in fair condition. This vessel is supported by four legs welded to this vessel and found to be structurally sound. All anchors bolts were securely fastened to the concrete foundation. The concrete foundation is above grade level and in good condition with no spalling or cracking noted. There is one PSV located on this vessel and it is on the top head. This PSV is missing service tag. The manufacturer data plate pressure is set at 600 PSIG which is above the vessel MAWP of 225 PSI. Recommend replacing the PSV with the correct set pressure for this vessel. During the thickness measurement inspection on the 24É??É?? man way there is sign of internal wall loss recommend an internal inspection on the next available time. All bolted flange and threaded connections to the shell and heads. There is no visual evidence of leakage or corrosion found. The next visual inspection will be time based at 5 years.
API 510 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was not completed during this inspection. Internal inspection is recommended at the next planned shut-down.
UltraPipe Unit ID ETHEL_D
UltraPipe Circut ID HEADER 4 TANK

Comments:
Ultrasonic A-Scan Inspection:
Ultrasonic A-Scan thickness measurements were performed on the heads, shell, and nozzles. All readings have been entered into Ultra Pipe and after review of the data the next inspection will be 04/07/2017. The predicted retirement date of the vessel is 01/06/2020 based on calculated corrosion rates and a 2 mil per year default corrosion rate. There is 0 caution TMLs per the current thickness survey taken on 07/10/2014.
API 510 External Inspection:
External inspection found the vessel to be in good condition. The coating on vessels exterior shell is in fair condition. This vessel is supported by four legs and structurally sounds. All anchors bolts were found securely fastened to the concrete foundation. The concrete foundation is above grade level and in good condition with no spalling or cracking present. There is only one PSV located on this vessel and it is located on the top head. The PSV pressure is set at 225 PSIG. All bolted flange and threaded connections to the shell and heads, there is no visual evidence of leakage or corrosion found. The next internal inspection will be time based per API 510 at 5 years.
API 510 Internal Inspection:
Internal inspection was not completed during this inspection.
UltraPipe Unit ID ETHEL_D
UltraPipe Circut ID HEADER 6 TANK
